content:
Have you created a userChrome.css file? That is the usual way to make permanent changes to the interface. For the card height (density) and font size, one option for the css is: 

/* message list card height & font */ .thread-card-container{      height: 60px !important;      font-size: 18px !important; }

Additional card css and instructions:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1447610
creator: sfhowes

content:
Added: It says "sending of password did not succeed". I'm able to receive email on TB but not send it from my Comcast account.

It asks me to enter the password for my email account for smtp.comcast.net - and it won't take my main password. How do I find my smtp password?
creator: JudsonMcCranie

content: If I understand correctly, you are making changes to comply with new MS direction. The requirement is - for incoming: outlook.office365.com, port 993, SSL/TLS, and Oauth2 (This is for IMAP accounts) - for output: smtp.office365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2
creator: davidsk

content: Check settings>composition and see if you have the box checked to save outgoing messages. If so, then click to addressbook, click to the collected addressbook, and delete the incorrect address.
creator: davidsk

content: Your screenshot only showed message list. What are you wanting to achieve? A different layout for all of thunderbird? Or just a different layout for the message list pane?
creator: davidsk

content: If the desire is to change message list view, see the attached screenshot.
creator: davidsk

content: More information is needed. Where are the existing folders stored? On the xtra.co.nz server or on your PC? If they are on the xtra.co.nz account, then I presume you were accessing the account via web interface, since you imply you used no email client. If that is true, then YES, you need an IMAP account, and the POP account is going to make it more difficult to combine the two - but still doable. I suggest you set up an IMAP account alongside the POP account in Thunderbird and that should show the other folders. The first screen on setup includes the option to specify IMAP. There is still work to salvage the accounts, but this should help you get started
creator: davidsk

content: I tried fiddling with a few other things. When I tried to reinstall my original hotmail account, when I fill in the info and hit continue a new box shows up "your login" with the ability to enter 'YOURDOMAIN\your user name. When I hit done I get the error message that the incoming server exists. When I do the exact same thing with the brand new outlook email account I get the could no get issuer message above and when I change to normal password I get the different message 'unable to log in at server'. Strange - the old and the new accounts at outlook.com get different error messages when I follow the exactly same steps. I am sure that I ame using the correct ID and password for both accounts.
